message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public static <K, V> V getRandomValInMap (Map<K, V> map) {
    Collection<V> values = map.values ();
    Iterator<V> it = values.iterator();
    int size = values.size();
    int item = new Random().nextInt(size); 
    int i = 0;
    while(it.hasNext()){
        V value = it.next();
        if (i == item)
            return value;
        i = i + 1;
    }
    return null;
}
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of trying to cast the collection to an array, you can use an Iterator to traverse the collection. You generate a random index and then iterate through the collection until you reach that index. The value at that index is then returned. This avoids the need for casting and the associated warning.
